title: Introduction to rchroma
text: rchroma package provides R interface ChromaDB, vector database storing querying embeddings. vignette demonstrates basic usage package.

title: Introduction to rchroma
text: can install development version rchroma GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("cynkra/rchroma")

title: Introduction to rchroma
text: using rchroma, need running ChromaDB instance. easiest way get started using Docker: start ChromaDB server http://localhost:8000. installation methods configuration options, please refer ChromaDB documentation.
code: docker pull chromadb/chroma docker run -p 8000:8000 chromadb/chroma

title: Introduction to rchroma
code: library(rchroma)  # Connect to a local ChromaDB instance client <- chroma_connect()  # Check the connection heartbeat(client) version(client)

title: Introduction to rchroma
text: Collections main way organize data ChromaDB:
code: # Create a new collection create_collection(client, "my_collection")  # List all collections list_collections(client)  # Get a specific collection get_collection(client, "my_collection")

title: Introduction to rchroma
text: Documents basic unit data ChromaDB. document consists text content associated embedding:
code: # Add documents with embeddings docs <- c(   "apple fruit",   "banana fruit",   "carrot vegetable" ) embeddings <- list(   c(1.0, 0.0, 0.0),  # apple   c(0.8, 0.2, 0.0),  # banana (similar to apple)   c(0.0, 0.0, 1.0)   # carrot (different) )  # Add documents to the collection add_documents(   client,   "my_collection",   documents = docs,   ids = c("doc1", "doc2", "doc3"),   embeddings = embeddings )  # Query similar documents using embeddings results <- query(   client,   "my_collection",   query_embeddings = list(c(1.0, 0.0, 0.0)),  # should match apple best   n_results = 2 )

title: Introduction to rchroma
code: # Update embedding separately update_documents(   client,   "my_collection",   ids = "doc1",   embeddings = list(c(0.9, 0.1, 0.0))  # slightly different from original apple )  # Delete documents delete_documents(client, "my_collection", ids = "doc2")  # removes banana

title: A Client for ChromaDB
text: rchroma provides clean interface ChromaDB, modern vector database storing querying embeddings.

title: A Client for ChromaDB
text: can install rchroma GitHub: also need running ChromaDB instance. easiest way get started using Docker: See ChromaDB documentation installation methods.
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("cynkra/rchroma") docker pull chromadb/chroma docker run -p 8000:8000 chromadb/chroma

title: A Client for ChromaDB
code: library(rchroma)  # Connect to ChromaDB client <- chroma_connect()  # Create a collection and add documents with embeddings create_collection(client, "my_collection") add_documents(   client,   "my_collection",   documents = c("apple", "banana"),   ids = c("doc1", "doc2"),   embeddings = list(     c(1.0, 0.0),  # apple     c(0.8, 0.2)   # banana (similar to apple)   ) )  # Query similar documents using embeddings query(   client,   "my_collection",   query_embeddings = list(c(1.0, 0.0)),  # should match apple best   n_results = 2 )

what: Query Documents in a Collection — query
title: Query Documents in a Collection — query
Query Documents in a Collection — query
code: query(   client,   collection_name,   query_embeddings,   n_results = 10L,   where = NULL,   where_document = NULL,   include = c("documents", "metadatas", "distances"),   tenant = "default_tenant",   database = "default_database" )

title: Query Documents in a Collection — query
text: client ChromaDB client object collection_name Name collection query_embeddings List query embeddings (must list numeric vectors) n_results Number results return per query (default: 10) Optional filtering conditions where_document Optional document-based filtering conditions include Optional vector include results. Possible values: "documents", "embeddings", "metadatas", "distances", "uris", "data" (default: c("documents", "metadatas", "distances")) tenant tenant name (default: "default") database database name (default: "default")

title: Query Documents in a Collection — query
text: list containing query results. element (documents, metadatas, distances) nested list, use double brackets [[]] access individual elements.

title: Query Documents in a Collection — query
text: Note ChromaDB's API accepts embeddings queries. want query using text, need first convert text embeddings using embedding model (e.g., using OpenAI's API, HuggingFace's API, local model). Example:
code: # First convert text to embeddings using your preferred method text_embedding <- your_embedding_function("your search text") # Then query using the embedding result <- query(client, "my_collection",                query_embeddings = list(text_embedding))

title: Reset ChromaDB — reset
text: function resets entire ChromaDB instance. Use caution delete data. Note: function requires setting ALLOW_RESET=TRUE environment variables allow_reset=True ChromaDB Settings.

title: Reset ChromaDB — reset
code: reset(client)
